frameDefinitions: This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.

A less-powerful person or group of people (the Activists) engages in an activity aimed to inconvenience or weaken a more powerful person or group (the Institution) to seek redress, in the form of a series of Demands, for the wrondgoings committed by the Instituion.  '
These words refer to an Agent joining Parts to form a Whole.
A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
A Container  is in a state of fullness/emptiness with respect to some Contents.
frameExamples: On March 17 , Mamedov <t>appointed</t> Rakhim Gasiyev as Defence Minister .
The workers were <t>striking</t> for better wages and better benefits.
Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
John carried a bucket <t>full</t> of water.
listRoleDefinitions: The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.

With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the <fen>Old_leader</fen> is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition <ment>against</ment>.
With words denoting appointment to a position, the <fen>New_leader</fen> is typically the object of verbs.

Frequently the <fen>Old_leader</fen> or <fen>New_leader</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.
The role <fen>Old_order</fen> identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs.
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>New_leader</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.
When the change takes place.
Where the change takes place.
The person or group of people that act out against the <fen>Institution</fen> in an attempt to have their <fen>Demands</fen> fullfilled.
The <fen>Institution</fen> is the company, factory, political party / institution, or entity that yields authority over the <fen>Activists</fen>.

The <fen>Demands</fen> are the guarantee(s) given by the <fen>Institution</fen> to the <fen>Activists</fen> that act to correct or address the issues or state of affairs that were grievous to the <fen>Activists</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location where the political action occurs.

In causative uses of these verbs there is an <fen>Agent</fen> responsible for amalgamating the <fen>Parts</fen>. The <fen>Agent</fen> is generally the External Argument (or the object of a PP-by in passives).
This  role identifies <fen>Whole</fen> as the entity resulting from combination of <fen>Parts</fen>.  When overtly expressed, it is usually a PP Complement (often headed by into).
This role identifies the <fen>Parts</fen> entities being combined, and is often expressed in a single plural NP, usually the direct object of a verb.
This role identifies the first of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. It  is most often the NP-Object of a verb.
This role identifies the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. It is usually a PP Complement.
The time at which the amalgamation occurs.
The location that the event occurs.
The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
<fen>Container</fen> is used for the entity whose fullness is being described.
<fen>Contents</fen> is used for the stuff that is present/absent in the <fen>Container</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Container</fen> is full.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The voters</fex> elected Blair.
The students overthrew <fex>the president</fex>.
The president appoints <fex>the prime minister</fex>.
The board of directors appointed Ashton <fex>Acting President</fex>.
The rebels overthrew <fex>the dictatorship</fex>.
His district elected her  <fex>to Congress</fex> three times.
The <fex>2000</fex> coup against the dictator was led by former president Smith.
The crew mutinied <fex>out in the middle of the Atlantic</fex>, the scoundrels.
<fex>The chef</fex> combined the ingredients.
Chuck merged the corpora <fex>into a database</fex>.
Chuck merged <fex>the corpora</fex> into a database.
The workmen joined <fex>the annex</fex> to the main building.
The workkmen joined the annex <fex>to the main building</fex>.
The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
His rhythmic <fex>tapping</fex> irritated her
The music had a driving rhythm
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
John carried an empty <fex>bucket</fex>.
The bucket is  full <fex>of water</fex>.
